trans-unit.source: $tagBLENDFUNCTION structure controls blending by specifying the blending functions for source and destination bitmaps

seg-source.mrk: $tagBLENDFUNCTION structure controls blending by specifying the blending functions for source and destination bitmaps

target.mrk: $tagBLENDFUNCTION structure controls blending by specifying the blending functions for source and destination bitmaps

trans-unit.source: Specifies an alpha transparency value to be used on the entire source bitmap. This value is combined with any per-pixel alpha values in the source bitmap. If set to 0, it is assumed that your image is transparent. Set to 255 (opaque) when you only want to use per-pixel alpha values.

seg-source.mrk: Specifies an alpha transparency value to be used on the entire source bitmap.
This value is combined with any per-pixel alpha values in the source bitmap.
If set to 0, it is assumed that your image is transparent.
Set to 255 (opaque) when you only want to use per-pixel alpha values.

target.mrk: Specifies an alpha transparency value to be used on the entire source bitmap.
This value is combined with any per-pixel alpha values in the source bitmap.
If set to 0, it is assumed that your image is transparent.
Set to 255 (opaque) when you only want to use per-pixel alpha values.

trans-unit.source: This member controls the way the source and destination bitmaps are interpreted:

seg-source.mrk: This member controls the way the source and destination bitmaps are interpreted:

target.mrk: This member controls the way the source and destination bitmaps are interpreted:

trans-unit.source: $AC_SRC_ALPHA - This flag is set when the bitmap has an Alpha channel (that is, per-pixel alpha). Note that the APIs use premultiplied alpha, which means that the red, green and blue channel values in the bitmap must be premultiplied with the alpha channel value.

seg-source.mrk: $AC_SRC_ALPHA - This flag is set when the bitmap has an Alpha channel (that is, per-pixel alpha).
Note that the APIs use premultiplied alpha, which means that the red, green and blue channel values in the bitmap must be premultiplied with the alpha channel value.

target.mrk: $AC_SRC_ALPHA - This flag is set when the bitmap has an Alpha channel (that is, per-pixel alpha).
Note that the APIs use premultiplied alpha, which means that the red, green and blue channel values in the bitmap must be premultiplied with the alpha channel value.

trans-unit.source: The source bitmap used with $tagBLENDFUNCTION must be 32 bpp

seg-source.mrk: The source bitmap used with $tagBLENDFUNCTION must be 32 bpp

target.mrk: The source bitmap used with $tagBLENDFUNCTION must be 32 bpp
